title: Firefly logo
content:
I'm surprised this hasn't come up. The font that the Firefly logo is based on has been an ongoing mystery. Rick Yaeger has identified most of the Firefly-related fonts here: [http://blogs.macmerc.com/rick/?p=232](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226174257/http:/blogs.macmerc.com/rick/?p=232).

I feel like I've seen those f's in some kind of OpenType ligature example.

author: pgaskill

comments.content:
There's an assumption that I find says something about us when we find it so hard to accept the idea that lettering can be done without using a computer. Unless you can find other examples of using this 'font' for more than this logo, I think you have to consider that maybe this lettering was done freehand.

- Mike Yanega

You're absolutely right, Mike. I would have been equally pleased to find out that it was freehand, and if that were the case I was hoping that somebody in the community would know who was responsible.

At any rate, it might inspire to take up arms and draw the rest of the alphabet as a learning experiment.
